1.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

2.text: Speak to the children of Israel and thou shalt say to them: When you shall be come into the land of your habitation, which I will give you,

3.text: And shall make an offering to the Lord, for a holocaust, or a victim, paying your vows, or voluntarily offering gifts, or in your solemnities burning a sweet savour unto the Lord, of oxen or of sheep:

4.text: Whosoever immolateth the victim, shall offer a sacrifice of fine flour, the tenth part of an ephi, tempered with the fourth part of a hin of oil:

5.text: And he shall give the same measure of wine to pour out in libations for the holocaust or for the victim. For every lamb,

6.text: And for every ram there shall be a sacrifice of hour of two tenths, which shall be tempered with the third part of a hin of oil:

7.text: And he shall offer the third part of the same measure of wine for the libation, for a sweet savour to the Lord.

8.text: But when thou offerest a holocaust or sacrifice of oxen, to fulfil thy vow or for victims of peace offerings,

9.text: Thou shalt give for every ox three tenths of flour tempered with half a hin of oil,

10.text: And wine for libations of the same measure, for an offering of most sweet savour to the Lord.

12.text: For every ox and ram and lamb and kid.

13.text: Both they that are born in the land, and the strangers

14.text: Shall offer sacrifices after the same rite.

15.text: There shall be all one law and judgment both for you and for them who are strangers in the land.

16.text: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

17.text: Speak to the children of Israel, and thou shalt say to them:

18.text: When you are come into the land which I will give you,

19.text: And shall eat of the bread of that country, you shall separate firstfruits to the Lord,

20.text: Of the things you eat. As you separate firstfruits of your barnfloors:

21.text: So also shall you give firstfruits of your dough to the Lord.

22.text: And if through ignorance you omit any of these things, which the Lord hath spoken to Moses,

23.text: And by him hath commanded you, from the day that he began to command and thenceforward,

24.text: And the multitude have forgotten to do it: they shall offer a calf out of the herd, a holocaust for a most sweet savour to the Lord, and the sacrifice and libations thereof, as the ceremonies require, and a buck goat for sin:

25.text: And the priest shall pray for all the multitude of the children of Israel: and it shall be forgiven them, because they sinned ignorantly, offering notwithstanding a burnt offering to the Lord for themselves and for their sin and their ignorance:

26.text: And it shall be forgiven all the people of the children of Israel: and the strangers that sojourn among them: because it is the fault of all the people through ignorance.

27.text: But if one soul shall sin ignorantly, he shall offer a she goat of a year old for his sin.

28.text: And the priest shall pray for him, because he sinned ignorantly before the Lord: and he shall obtain his pardon, and it shall be forgiven him.

29.text: The same law shall be for all that sin by ignorance, whether they be natives or strangers.

30.text: But the soul that committeth any thing through pride, whether he be born in the land or a stranger (because he hath been rebellious against the Lord) shall be cut off from among his people:

31.text: For he hath contemned the word the Lord, and made void his precept: therefore shall he be destroyed, and shall bear his iniquity.

32.text: And it came to pass, when the children of Israel were in the wilderness, and had found a man gathering sticks on the sabbath day,

33.text: That they brought him to Moses and Aaron and the whole multitude.

34.text: And they put him into prison, not knowing what they should do with him.

35.text: And the Lord said to Moses: Let that man die, let all the multitude stone him without the camp.

36.text: And when they had brought him out, they stoned him, and he died as the Lord had commanded.

37.text: The Lord also said to Moses:

38.text: Speak to the children of Israel, and thou shalt tell them to make to themselves fringes in the corners of their garments, putting in them ribands of blue:

39.text: That when they shall see them, they may remember all the commandments of the Lord, and not follow their own thoughts and eyes going astray after divers things,

40.text: But rather being mindful of the precepts of the Lord, may do them and be holy to their God.

41.text: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, that I might be your God.
